articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Chinese Delegation
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Chinese Delegation 
Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with the delegation of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference led by Vice-Chairman Chen Zongxing at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Friday.
					 On the occasion, the head of the delegation said that the traditional Sino-DPRK friendly relations are growing stronger under the deep care of the leaders of the two countries.
					
					 He wished the Korean people register greater successes under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Chinese Delegation
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from the visiting delegation of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference.
					 The gift was handed over to Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, on Friday by Vice-Chairman Chen Zongxing who is heading the delegation.

articles.title: Chinese Delegation Winds Up Visit to DPRK
articles.content:
Chinese Delegation Winds Up Visit to DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference led by Vice-Chairman Chen Zongxing returned home on Friday after winding up its visit to the DPRK.
					 During the stay, the delegation visited Mangyongdae, the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Arch of Triumph, the Ssuksom Revolutionary Site and other places.

articles.title: Chinese VIP Interviewed
articles.content:
Chinese VIP Interviewed
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference will as ever strive to make a positive contribution to the development of the traditional Sino-DPRK friendship. Vice-chairman Chen Zongxing who is heading the delegation of its National Committee said this when interviewed by KCNA before its departure from the DPRK.
					 Noting that during his stay in the DPRK he was deeply moved to see the Korean people waging a dynamic drive to develop economy and improve the standard of their living in the revolutionary spirit of self-reliance, he continued:
					
					 I got strong impression at the International Friendship Exhibition House.
					
					Displayed there are gifts presented to President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il by different countries.
					
					 Through the visit to the house, I keenly realized world people's reverence for them.
					
					 Revolutionaries of the old generation of China and Kim Il Sung provided the Sino-DPRK ties in the days of the struggle for accomplishing the common cause.
					
					 These friendly relations are developing as the days go by under the deep care of General Secretary Hu Jintao and Kim Jong Il.
					
					  China and the DPRK have conducted exchange and cooperation in political, economic, cultural and other fields.
					
					 The Sino-DPRK friendship sealed in blood.
					
					 It is our belief that the Korean people will more dynamically carry on production and construction under the leadership of Kim Jong Il and thus significantly greet 2012, the centenary of birth of the President.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Congratulates President of Chad
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Congratulates President of Chad
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Friday sent a congratulatory message to Idriss Deby Itno upon his reelection as president of Chad.
					 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Chad would grow stronger with each passing day, Kim in the message sincerely wished the president new success in his responsible work for national unity and economic development of the country.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Congratulates PM of Mali
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Congratulates PM of Mali
Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim Friday sent a congratulatory message to Cisse Mariam Kaidama Sidibe upon her appointment as Prime Minister of Mali.
					Expressing belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger with each passing day, the message wished the Prime Minister success in her responsible work.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Greets Kuwaiti PM
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Greets Kuwaiti PM
Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim Friday sent a message of greetings to Sheikh Nasser Al-Muhammad Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah upon his reappointment as Prime Minister of Kuwait.
					 The message wished the prime minister good health and happiness and new success in his responsible work for the economic development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Chinese Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers
articles.content:
Chinese Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Charge d'Affaires ad Interim Li Qingjiang and staff members of the Chinese embassy here did friendly work on the DPRK-China Friendship Thaekam Cooperative Farm in Sunan District, Pyongyang, on Thursday.
					 After being briefed on the history of the farm they helped the farmers in rice-transplanting.
					
					 During a break they exchanged conversation with farmers.
					
					 They handed aid materials to the farm.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Marked 
Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held at the People's Palace of Culture Friday to mark the 20th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Theory of Architectural Art".
					 The work published on May 21, Juche 80 (1991) clarified from fresh angle the essence, character and mission of architecture under socialism, position and role played by it in the development of society and fundamental issues in the creation of architecture under socialism based on scientific clarification of the relations between architecture and the society and between architecture and human.  
					
					  Present there were Premier Choe Yong Rim, Minister of Construction and Building Materials Industry Tong Jong Ho, Minister of Urban Management Hwang Hak Won, Minister of Land and Environmental Conservation Kim Chang Ryong, officials of ministries and national institutions, architectural designers in Pyongyang and officials in the field of construction.
					
					 Minister of State Construction Control Pae Tal Jun who is chairman of the C.C., the Union of Architects of Korea, said that the work comprehensively and systematically deals with theoretical and practical issues arising in the creation of architecture under socialism from Juche-oriented stand.
					
					 Kim Jong Il aroused architects and builders to the struggle to bring into reality President Kim Il Sung's desire for building a rich and powerful country, the reporter said, and continued:
					
					 A land of bliss has been built in the era of Songun and great successes have been made in the efforts to improve the standard of people's living and build a thriving nation thanks to the patriotic devotion of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The reporter called on officials and working people in the field to devote wisdom, talent and enthusiasm to the on-going general drive and thus make tangible contribution to accelerating the day of victory in building a thriving nation.

articles.title: Architectural Art Makes Rapid Progress
articles.content:
Architectural Art Makes Rapid Progress
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The 11th May 21 Architectural Festival and the 6th Symposium on Architectural Aesthetics were held in Pyongyang some time ago.
					 Through the events the Korean people felt again a pride of having a master of architectural art.
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il published a celebrated work "Theory on Architectural Art" in May Juche 80 (1991), in which he gave all-round and profound answers to theoretical and practical questions arising in architectural development.
					
					 The work explains the essence and characteristics of the Juche-based architecture and clarifies the principles and theories a working-class party should maintain in architectural development.
					
					 The ideas and theories expounded in the work were created in the course of developing the Juche-based architecture.
					
					 The DPRK launched a speed campaign in construction in the 1970s and built many edifices in the 1980s.
					
					 Among those built in Pyongyang are the Tower of Juche Idea, Arch of Triumph, Grand People's Study House, Mansudae Art Theatre, and Rakwon, Changgwang, Munsu and Kwangbok streets.
					
					 The validity and vitality of the work has been fully demonstrated in the Songun (military-first) era.
					
					 In recent years, an e-library of Kim Il Sung University, Pyongyang Kim Won Gyun Conservatory, Majon Hotel and State Theatre were successfully built as required by Kim Jong Il's great ideas of architecture.

articles.title: Football Coaching Course Held
articles.content:
Football Coaching Course Held
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- An AFC "B" license award coaching course was held in Pyongyang from April 29 to May 18.
					 The course took place at Kim Il Sung Stadium and Yanggakdo Football Stadium, divided into theoretical and practical workshops. 
					
					 Football coaches from various sports teams and teachers of juvenile sports schools participated in the course. The course dealt with the system of football match, offense and defense tactics, physical training methods and medical treatment.
					
					 Adeshir Pournamet, a lecturer of the AFC, gave a lecture at the course.

articles.title: DPRK Wrestlers Prove Successful at Asian Championship
articles.content:
DPRK Wrestlers Prove Successful at Asian Championship
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Wrestlers of the DPRK Yang Kyong Il and Yang Chun Song placed the first at the 55 kg and 66 kg categories of men's freestyle wrestling matches of the 2011 Asian Wrestling Championship.
					 They defeated their Japanese and Uzbek rivals at the finals to get gold medals.
					
					 Wrestler of the DPRK Ri Jong Myong came third at the 60 kg category of men's freestyle wrestling match.

articles.title: Great Changes Take Place in Fruit Farms
articles.content:
Great Changes Take Place in Fruit Farms
						
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Ryongjon and Toksong fruit farms on the east coast of the DPRK have turned into large fruit producers as required by the new century.  
					 The officials and other members of the fruit farms created vast areas of orchards, putting them on a modern and scientific basis.  
					
					 The orchards of short apple trees of high-yielding species are now pervaded with sweet smell of white flowers.  
					
					 The above-said fruit farms succeeded in developing short fruit trees of new species suited to the climatic and soil conditions of the areas. 
					
					 They built their own bases for producing saplings on the basis of the newly-developed method of short fruit tree sapling production. As a result, productivity jumped ten times over the production of ordinary saplings. 
					
					 The fruit farms dug trench-style ditches with a total length of hundreds of kilometers and introduced a rotation production cycle of fruit farming and stock-breeding. 
					
					 A lot of quality organic fertilizer is now being produced from the combined stock-breeding bases and organic composite fertilizer production centers there. More than 100 tons per hectare have been applied to orchards to significantly increase the fertility of soil and steadily boost the fruit production. 
					
					 They also built their own vegetable agricultural chemical production centers depending on locally available raw and other materials, greatly contributing to the fruit production. 
					
					 There appeared on the farms roads with a total length of dozens of km that crisscross the orchards, cave-like fruit stores and air-conditioned fruit stores, changing their appearance beyond recognition.  
					
					 Modern houses and cultural and welfare establishments for farmers nestle at the foot of each hill. The farms look like a beautiful picture.

articles.title: Geological Prospecting Goes Well
articles.content:
Geological Prospecting Goes Well 
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Provincial prospecting bureaus under the Ministry of State Resource Development have scored a good result in geological prospecting.
					The Ryanggang Provincial Prospecting Bureau has found out a large deposit of valuable minerals in Namsa area.
					
					 The South Hamgyong Provincial Prospecting Bureau has spotted a new mineral vein in Komdok area and confirmed ore bodies in the eastern and western parts of the area.
					
					 The South Phyongan Provincial Prospecting Bureau has made a survey of new coalfields.
					
					 Such achievements have also been reported from the South Hwanghae and Kangwon provincial prospecting bureaus.
					
					 Technicians of the Ministry of State Resource Development and the South Hamgyong Provincial Prospecting Bureau have solved technical problems in utilizing geothermal water in a rational way. 
					
					 The prospectors of the country are commemorating the 50th anniversary of President Kim Il Sung's work "On Giving Definite Priority to Geological Prospecting" and the 20th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's letter "Let Us Bring About a Fresh Turn in Geological Prospecting."

articles.title: Old Lamp Devices Showcase Talent of Korean People
articles.content:
Old Lamp Devices Showcase Talent of Korean People
						
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- An exhibition of old lamp devices has been held at the Korean Folklore Museum in Pyongyang from February.
					 Lamp devices include candlesticks, lamp stands and lanterns.
					
					Some of the candlesticks are patterned with butterfly and mythical unicorn-lion.
					
					 Brass lamp stands made in the Ri Dynasty (1392-1910) period are utility handicrafts indicative of the Korean people's skill.
					
					 Lanterns are diverse in kind and shape.
					
					 The exhibition draws more than a hundred pieces representing different ages.

articles.title: Historic Spring Mingyuegou Meeting
articles.content:
Historic Spring Mingyuegou Meeting 
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Eighty years has elapsed since President Kim Il Sung called a meeting at Mingyuegou, Yanji County, in the spring of 1931.
					 At that time, the situation was very grave.
					
					 After the May 30 uprising and the August 1 uprising, the Japanese imperialists intensified the repressive campaign in Manchuria and destroyed many underground revolutionary organizations.
					
					 In order to save the difficult situation, the President launched efforts to unite the masses.
					
					 He organized a short course at Dunhua for members of the Korean Revolutionary Army and core members of revolutionary organizations and discussed ensuring unified leadership over basic party organizations and rallying people.
					
					 He convened a meeting of cadres of the party and the Young Communist League in Mingyuegou on May 20, Juche 20 (1931).
					
					At the meeting he delivered a historic speech, "Let Us Repudiate the ′Left′ Adventurist Line and Follow the Revolutionary Organizational Line.  He in the speech made a profound analysis of the reactionary nature of the May 30 uprising and put forth a revolutionary organizational line on uniting the whole nation into a political force by closely rallying the basic masses and other anti-Japanese forces of all social strata around them.
					
					 After the meeting the revolutionary organizations in Mingyuegou and Antu were put on the right track in a short span of time and those in other areas revitalized.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Greater Surge in Pilot Sectors of National Economy
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Greater Surge in Pilot Sectors of National Economy 
						
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- It is necessary for the four pilot sectors of the national economy to bring a leap forward in the van of the drive for a great surge in order to bring about a decisive turn in the efforts to improve the standard of people's living and build a thriving nation this year, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in an editorial.
					 The dynamism in the above-said sectors means the speed of the on-going advance for a great surge, the editorial says, and goes on: 
					
					 Sky-high is the spirit of the workers in those sectors. This gives strong spurs to the drive for a great surge in all the domains of national economy including light industry and agriculture. The people of the country are greatly encouraged by the exploits performed by the workers in those sectors making a breakthrough in the onward movement to provide starting fire for the drive to improve the standard of people's living. 
					
					The officials and workers in the above-said four sectors should not slacken their spirit even a bit but bring about uninterrupted innovations and progress to greet the significant 2012, keeping pace with General Secretary Kim Jong Il's forced march for field guidance.
					
					 They should glorify the leadership exploits performed by Kim Jong Il in the efforts to make signal progress in those sectors with spectacular successes in the production drive and competition for increased production. 
					
					 The editorial calls on the officials and workers in those sectors to attain without fail the goals of those four sectors set by the Workers' Party of Korea.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak's Ambition for Unification of Systems Dismissed as Ridiculous
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak's Ambition for Unification of Systems Dismissed as Ridiculous
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- During his German junket traitor Lee Myung Bak of south Korea disclosed his intention to bring down the system in the dignified DPRK and is now working hard to realize it at any cost. But this is no more than a daydream.
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday observes this in a bylined article.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The spate of provocative remarks made by Lee even during his foreign trip is nothing but a buffoonery of a political ignoramus.
					
					 As far as contingency is concerned, this will happen to the conservative group only as it lacks in any proper political philosophy and is tight-cornered by the south Koreans' fierce anti-"government" actions. 
					
					 It is an intolerable insult and provocation to the DPRK that Lee dares to bring down its socialism, the lifeline of the Korean people though he is in such poor position that he cannot solve his own problems.
					
					 The south Korean conservative group's racket for confrontation of the systems is a treacherous one to do harm to fellow countrymen under the signboard of "unification" and realize its wild ambition for "unification under liberal democracy."
					
					The Lee Myung Bak group can never escape punishment for its swimming against the trend of the national history toward independence, reunification and peace and prosperity.

articles.title: Actions Staged against S. Korean Authorities' Treacherous Rule
articles.content:
Actions Staged against S. Korean Authorities' Treacherous Rule
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions and the "Seoul Solidarity for Hope of Working People" have been on a grand march against discrimination in Seoul since May 16 with workers, students, citizens and other people of various social standings attending.
					 Prior to the march, they held a rally.
					
					 Speakers at the rally accused the present ruling forces of enforcing a treacherous rule making the poor poorer and the rich richer.
					
					 Pursuant to this policy, enterprises are massively increasing part-time jobs and making the living of the workers harder, they charged.
					
					 They declared that the people from all walks of life would stage the grand march to have wages paid, win the basic right to labor and the people's right to existence and achieve peace against war.
					
					 During the period of the march its participants will bring to light the present regime and enterprise owners' acts of suppressing trade unions and unreasonably dismissing workers and demand a stop to them, they stressed.

articles.title: Attempt to Call Back Departed Soul of Fascist Dictatorship Flayed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Attempt to Call Back Departed Soul of Fascist Dictatorship Flayed in S. Korea
						
Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore on May 17 carried an editorial titled "Reason to call back departed soul of May 16 coup".
					 The conservative forces and media are now openly eulogizing Park Chung Hee, who was shot to death by his confidant, after making desperate efforts to put forward Syngman Rhee, the editorial pointed out.
					
					 It is clear to everyone that the reason is to pave the way for coming to power again in the elections slated for next year, it said.
					
					 The conservative forces are asserting that Park developed the economy and, accordingly, repression and dictatorship over democracy are inevitable for the economic growth, it charged.
					
					 In fact, Park's economic policy caused price jump, tightened system of low wage and destruction of the countryside and, consequently, repression and tyranny were enforced to tide over the crisis entailed from this, the editorial said.
					
					 It demanded that the conservative forces no longer make a mockery of the people.

articles.title: Actions to Punish Present Regime Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Actions to Punish Present Regime Called for in S. Korea 
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea issued a commentary on May 18 on the occasion of the 31st anniversary of the Kwangju Popular Uprising. It called for intensifying the actions for punishing the present regime for going against the times by inheriting the spirit of the participants in the May 18 resistance.
					 The Kwangju popular resistance was an eruption of the resentment of the people at the "Yusin" system which turned south Korea into a theatre of fascist dictatorship and tyrannical rule and a manifestation of their ardent desire for independence, democracy and reunification, the commentary said, and continued:
					
					 The resistance taught the truth of history that social democracy and independent reunification of the nation are not something to be presented by anyone but should be won through a struggle.
					
					 31 years have passed since the resistance, but the present regime has allowed the arch criminals who murdered people to be at large and brought the inter-Korean relations which favorably developed once back to those in the past era of confrontation, it charged.

articles.title: Merger of Opposition Parties Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Merger of Opposition Parties Urged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The Democratic Party of south Korea held a commemoration of the 31st anniversary of the Kwangju Popular Uprising, at which it called for merger of opposition parities, according to the KBS of south Korea on May 18.  
					 Speakers at the commemoration said that regime change should be made without fail next year in the spirit of the Kwangju martyrs. 
					
					 To this end, it is important to achieve merger of opposition parties, they stressed.  
					
					 Saying that solidarity is part of the spirit displayed in the Kwangju uprising, they called for starting the discussion on formation of a unitary political party in opposition camp.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak's Reckless Remarks Blasted
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak's Reckless Remarks Blasted
						
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The Central Association of Korean Nationals in Russia issued a statement on May 15 condemning traitor Lee Myung Bak for his recent provocative remarks against the DPRK.
					 During his tour of Germany Lee claimed that the north's denuclearization is prerequisite to unification. He also let loose a string of balderdash justifying the moves for confrontation with the DPRK while demanding someone's "apology" for the cases of warship sinking and Yonphyong Island shelling.
					
					 Referring to this fact, the statement said: We cannot but be shunned by Lee's vile remarks taking issue with the DPRK without discretion outside.
					
					 In order to incite confrontation with the DPRK, he cooked up a lot of plots and answered the DPRK's proposal for wide-ranging dialogue with war maneuvers, it charged.
					
					 The statement demanded that Lee no longer resort to dependence on foreign forces and confrontation with the DPRK, well aware of what is the south Korean people's mindset shown in the April 27 by-election.

articles.title: Juche Idea Praised by Foreigners
articles.content:
Juche Idea Praised by Foreigners 
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Foreigners who visited the DPRK noted with admiration that the Juche idea has become a guiding idea in the era of independence.
					 Muhammad Berkat Ullah who visited the DPRK at the head of the delegation of the Pakistani Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea said that President Kim Il Sung founded the great Juche idea and embodied it in practice, adding:
					
					 He firmly maintained the Juche-oriented stand while leading the arduous and complicated Korean revolution.
					
					 I am convinced that the Korean people will build a great prosperous and powerful socialist nation without fail under the uplifted banner of Juche.
					
					 Kamwiziku Octave, secretary general of the African Regional Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, noted that Kim Il Sung projected the working masses as a driving force of history, adding:
					
					 Thanks to this great idea the DPRK has made shining achievements. 
					
					 The cause of global independence is sure to be accomplished when we advance under the banner of Juche.
					
					 We will conduct more brisk activities to explain and disseminate the Juche idea among the peoples of the African countries.
					
					 Matteo Carbonelli, secretary general of the European Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, said:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung was a prominent thinker and theoretician who founded the Juche idea and a great statesman.
					
					The Juche idea founded by him has been developed and enriched by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Korean people are effecting innovations in production and construction, guided by the Juche idea.

articles.title: Seminar on Juche Idea Held in Peru
articles.content:
Seminar on Juche Idea Held in Peru
						
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- A Peruvian national seminar on the Juche idea for independence in the 21st century took place at National University of Callao on May 12.
					 Attending it were personages of the Peruvian Group for the Study of Kimilsungism, the General Kim Jong Il Peruvian Amicable Institute, the Peruvian Association for the Study of Revolutionary Activities of Comrade Kim Jong Suk, the Communist Party of Peru (Red Motherland), the Peruvian Communist Party, the Peru-Korea Friendship Institute for the Study of Juche Songun Policy, the Peruvian Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea and the said university and masses.
					
					 Present on invitation were the ambassador and staff members of the DPRK embassy in Lima and a delegation of the Social Scientists Society of Korea.
					
					 Speeches were made at the seminar by Roberto Carbonel Peso, president of the Peru-Korea Friendship Institute for the Study of Juche Songun Policy, and other personages.
					
					They stressed that the Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung and enriched by General Secretary Kim Jong Il is the man-centered idea and it has been briskly studied and disseminated in many countries and regions.
					
					 They said that many revolutionaries and people of the world struggling for national independence and sovereignty regard the Juche idea as their guidelines.
					
					 They said that the DPRK has turned into a genuine people's country where everyone leads a worthwhile life as master of the state and society and a powerful country where the sovereignty of the country and the dignity of the nation are reliably defended by the Songun politics as the great Juche idea has been thoroughly embodied in all realms of social life.
					
					 They underscored the need to make full preparations for a world conference on the Juche idea to be held in Pyongyang in April 2012.

articles.title: DPRK's Proposal for Korea's Reunification Supported in Finland
articles.content:
DPRK's Proposal for Korea's Reunification Supported in Finland
						
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Antti Sika Aho, chairman of the Finland-Korea Society, released a statement on May 10 in support of the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo.
					 Kim Il Sung, eternal president of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, set forth the proposal at the 6th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea in October 1980, the statement noted.
					
					 This proposal still serves as the most just and realistic reunification proposal, though several decades have passed, as it presupposes co-existence of the systems in the north and the south and does not harm interests of each side, it said, adding:
					
					 The best way for realizing Korea's reunification at an early date is to found a national unified state by means of federation based on one nation, one state, two systems and two governments.
					
					 The international community continues to lift up the voices of accusation against the south Korean authorities escalating the tension on the Korean Peninsula by pursuing the policy of confrontation with the DPRK.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should not persist in the confrontation policy but respond to the DPRK-proposed dialogue and adopt a proper policy helpful to Korea's reunification.
					
					 Korea should be surely reunified according to the DFRK founding proposal advanced by Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Decision on Holding World Conference on Juche Idea Hailed in Russia and Nepal
articles.content:
Decision on Holding World Conference on Juche Idea Hailed in Russia and Nepal
						
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Russia and Nepal expressed full support for the decision of the 13th enlarged meeting of the Executive Committee of the Board of Directors of the International Institute of the Juche Idea.
					 The Dagestan Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy of Russia, in its May 13 statement, fully supported the decision.
					
					 The decision put stress on the position of the Juche idea followers in the world, the statement said, adding:
					
					 We will do our best to contribute to the study and dissemination of the Juche idea.
					
					 We call upon the Juche idea study organizations in the world to intensify their activities with the forthcoming centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung as an occasion.
					
					 The Nepal Journalist Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Politics made public its resolution on May 9.
					
					 The resolution stressed the need to organize commemorative and solidarity events and activate the study and dissemination of the Juche idea for whipping up the worldwide atmosphere for commemorating the 100th birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung and laud the feats of General Secretary Kim Jong Il wisely guiding the Korean people in the efforts for the building of a great prosperous and powerful nation and lasting peace of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The Association will hold various events, including seminar on the Juche idea, meeting, film show and photo and book exhibition, in the capital and localities of the country from January 2012 and widely introduce the Juche idea and the Songun politics through media, it said.

articles.title: Russia Rejects Japan's Protest over Kuriles
articles.content:
Russia Rejects Japan's Protest over Kuriles
						
 Moscow, May 18 (KCNA) -- The Foreign Ministry of Russia on May 16 rejected Japan's protest against the visit to southern Kuriles by Russia's government delegation.
					 That day the Japanese authorities protested the Russian side, expressing "regret" over the visit.
					
					 Branding this as a wrong behavior, the ministry said that Russia's claim to Kuril Islands is based on international law. The action of Japan continuing to make question of it does not conform to the improvement of Russia-Japan relations, it added.

articles.title: Russia Clarifies Its Stand Not to Compromise over Issue of Missile Shield
articles.content:
Russia Clarifies Its Stand Not to Compromise over Issue of Missile Shield
						
 Moscow, May 18 (KCNA) -- Deputy Defense Minister Anatoly Antonov at a recent news conference clarified his country's stand not to compromise over the issue of missile shield. 
					 "We continue uneasy, sticky talks with our U.S. and NATO partners" he said, adding that the talks serve as a touchstone which shows whether the member nations of NATO, especially the U.S., have the will to cooperate with Russia on the basis of equality and mutual respect.
					
					 He clarified that any agreement below the quality of the Strategic Arms Reduction Treaty is unnecessary, stressing that Russia would neither step back even a bit from its principled stand nor compromise over this issue even at the sacrifice of national security.

articles.title: Russia Plans to Equip Its Strategic Rocket Force with New-type Missiles
articles.content:
Russia Plans to Equip Its Strategic Rocket Force with New-type Missiles 
						
 Moscow, May 18 (KCNA) -- The commander of the Strategic Rocket Force of Russia at a press conference on May 17 referred to the plan to equip it with new-type missiles.
					 The Strategic Rocket Force will be equipped with fifth generation missiles "PC-24" till 2018, he said, adding that the proportion of those missiles will reach 80 percent.
					
					 He said that this is not a violation of the spirit of international treaties Russia concluded including the new Strategic Arms Reduction Treaty. The new-type inter-continental ballistic missiles of Russia will cope with any missile defense system, he added.

articles.title: China Calls for Respect for Path of Developing Green Economy Chosen by Each Country
articles.content:
China Calls for Respect for Path of Developing Green Economy Chosen by Each Country
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- China's UN ambassador Li Baodong at the recent Ministerial Dialogue on Moving Towards Sustainable Development Expectations for Rio+20 as a part of the 19th Session of the UN Commission on Sustainable Development (CSD) said that path of developing green economy chosen by each country based on their specific national conditions should be respected.
					 "Countries differ in resource endowment and development levels. It is imperative to respect the path of developing green economy chosen by each country's government based on their specific national conditions. There should not be unified standard or set of indicators," he said.

articles.title: Cuba Rejects US Claim over Dissident's Death
articles.content:
Cuba Rejects US Claim over Dissident's Death 
 Havana, May 18 (KCNA) -- Cuba on Monday rejected U.S. politicians' claim over the death of a Cuban dissident, saying Washington said so because it is "seeking excuses" to invade the island country.
					 The official daily Granma said in an editorial that the claim over the death of Juan Wilfredo Soto Garcia is the most recent example of the "hundreds of smear campaigns" orchestrated by the U.S. government against Cuba.
					
					 The editorial stressed that the Cuban people will never surrender to the smear campaigns of the U.S. but take resolute measures against them.

articles.title: Brazil Succeeds in Preventing Crimes
articles.content:
Brazil Succeeds in Preventing Crimes
						
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Brazil's Rio de Janeiro state recorded in March the lowest murder rate in 20 years, according to a report released on Monday by its Public Security Institute.
					 There were 374 murders in the state in March, down from 492 in the same period last year.
					
					 The number of victims of violent crimes fell 23.1 percent.

articles.title: Iran Condemns Killing of Palestinians by Israeli Troops
articles.content:
Iran Condemns Killing of Palestinians by Israeli Troops
 Tehran, May 18 (KCNA) -- Iranian Foreign Minister Ali-Akbar Salehi condemned killing of Palestinian protestors by Israeli forces on Sunday.
					 That day Israeli troops fired at Palestinian protesters in Lebanon, the West Bank and occupied Golan, who demanded the right of refugees to return home. The shooting caused big casualties.
					
					 Dismissing the move as a violation of international norms and regulations, Salehi called on the international circles to deal with Israeli crimes as soon as possible.
					
					 The only way to tackle Tel Aviv's repressive policies is through massive popular resistance, he said.

articles.title: Iran to Launch Human Rights News Agency
articles.content:
Iran to Launch Human Rights News Agency
						
 Tehran, May 18 (KCNA) -- A senior Iranian Lawmaker announced on Monday that Tehran would soon launch an English-language news agency to review the latest human rights abuses in the West, specially in the UK and the U.S.
					 Vice-Chairman of the Parliament's Human Rights Committee Mohammad Karim Abedi said the Human Rights News Agency will exclusively deal with human rights issues in English language.

articles.title: US Plans to Deploy Drones in Asia-Pacific Region
articles.content:
US Plans to Deploy Drones in Asia-Pacific Region
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The United States is planning to deploy in the Asia-Pacific region drones to be used for aggression on regional countries.
					 The commander of the U.S. Seventh Fleet in an interview with AP on May 17 said that some sea-based drones would likely be deployed in the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 He said: "They will play an integral role in our future operations in this region."

articles.title: US Urged to Pay Heed to Public Call for Pullback of Its Forces
articles.content:
US Urged to Pay Heed to Public Call for Pullback of Its Forces
 Pyongyang. May 20 (KCNA) -- The United States should not turn its face away from the trend of the times and public mind-set but pull its forces out of south Korea at an early date, urges Rodong Sinmun Friday in a bylined commentary.
					 The U.S. magazine Forbes carried an article contributed by a senior researcher of the Cato Research Institute in which he said the U.S. forces' presence in south Korea is no longer necessary, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 It is the demand of the times to withdraw the U.S. forces from south Korea and a matter whose solution cannot be avoided by the U.S. any longer.
					
					 If the U.S. is to get rid of the situation where it is facing increasing rebuff and condemnation of the world peace-loving people and at home, it should drop its policy of domination and interference in internal affairs of other countries and pull back its forces from various parts of world, from south Korea, in particular, as early as possible.
					
					 The DPRK has made sincere efforts for peace but even the issue of building a peace mechanism on the Korean Peninsula has not yet been discussed due to the objection of the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. behavior sidestepping the above-said issue is little short of openly evading its obligation as the party directly responsible for solving the issue of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					The U.S. is busy ceaselessly escalating the tension on the peninsula to hurt someone, still obsessed with the anachronistic way of thinking and daydream. This does the U.S. itself no good.
					
					 It is the unanimous demand of fair public opinion that its hostile policy toward the DPRK should be rolled back and its forces should quit south Korea.
					
					 If the U.S. persistently pursues its anachronistic hostile policy toward the DPRK and its scenario for its forces' permanent presence in south Korea, not lending an ear to this, it will find itself in a deeper mire of international isolation and destruction.

articles.title: US Deficit Problems Undermine Future Economic Strength
articles.content:
US Deficit Problems Undermine Future Economic Strength
						
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The U.S. fiscal problems are so pressing that they threaten to undermine the foundation of our future economic strength, said the U.S. Treasury secretary on Tuesday.

articles.title: Argentina Urges Reform of UN Security Council
articles.content:
Argentina Urges Reform of UN Security Council
						
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Argentine Foreign Minister Hector Timerman on Monday called for reforming the UN Security Council to allow a broader representation of countries.
					 He made the appeal at a UN meeting on global governance and reform of the council.
					
					 Timerman said that it would be natural for Latin America and the Caribbean region as a whole to select its candidates based on regional consensus and then promote them at the UN General Assembly.

articles.title: Cooperation among Countries
articles.content:
Cooperation among Countries
						
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Russia and Slovenia on Monday agreed to cooperate with each other in the matter of European security and develop bilateral relations in various fields.
					 This agreement was made during the Slovenian president's visit to Russia.
					
					 On the same day Nigeria and Niger agreed to strengthen cooperation with each other in strategies to fight crimes and military field.

articles.title: Developing Countries Called upon to Develop Science and Technology
articles.content:
Developing Countries Called upon to Develop Science and Technology 
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- Developing countries should counter the scientific and technological blockade of the imperialists with strategies for scientific and technological development, firmly adhering to the principle of independence and self-reliance and thus explore new areas of modern science and technology and accelerate the independent development of the country. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday says this in a by-lined article. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The imperialists leave no stone unturned to monopolize science and technology in pursuance of their aggressive and predatory purposes.
					
					The imperialists bar developing countries from introducing scientific and technological research successes by putting up a variety of unreasonable conditions under the calculation that if science and technology are developed in those countries, it will make hard for them to realize their ambition for hegemony.
					
					 Now that the imperialists are becoming craftier and more vicious in their moves to dominate and plunder other countries by means of science and technology, developing countries should counter the imperialists' scientific and technological blockade with their own scientific and technological development strategies.
					
					 It is important for developing countries to develop science and technology by their own efforts as required by their specific conditions and realistic demand from the firm standpoint of Juche.
					
					 When boosting the scientific and technological exchange with other countries and introducing new science and technology it is necessary to do so in conformity with the specific conditions of their countries.
					
					 If developing countries encourage their people to fully display their efforts and wisdom and positively harness all the possibilities and potentials, they can reach a high level of the development of science and technology and achieve the independent development and prosperity of their countries by dint of modern science and technology.
					
					 The experience gained by the DPRK in practice and its reality go to prove that if countries, though backward,   buckle down to developing science and technology with a will from an independent and creative standpoint and on the principle of self-reliance, they can certainly achieve scientific and technological progress, concludes the article.

articles.title: UN Agency Says 45 Percent of Latin America's Children Live in Poverty
articles.content:
UN Agency Says 45 Percent of Latin America's Children Live in Poverty
						
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- About 81 million children and adolescents in Latin America and the Caribbean, or the equivalent of about 45 percent of this population group, live in poverty, two United Nations agencies said in a report Tuesday.

articles.title: 7 Killed in US Drone Strike in Northwest Pakistan
articles.content:
7 Killed in US Drone Strike in Northwest Pakistan
						
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- The U.S. forces in Afghanistan committed air raid on Pakistan on May 16 under the pretext of "anti-terrorism".
					 At least seven people were killed when U.S. drones fired two missiles at a militant school in the Miranshah area of North Waziristan.
					
					 The ceaseless air raid of the U.S. forces is arousing great resentment from among the inhabitants.

articles.title: 6.3-magnitude Quake Hits Solomon Islands
articles.content:
6.3-magnitude Quake Hits Solomon Islands
						
 Pyongyang, May 20 (KCNA) -- An earthquake measuring 6.3 on the Richter scale hit Solomon Islands on Monday.
					 The epicenter was monitored at 6.1 degrees south latitude and 154.4 degrees east longitude with a depth of about 40 kilometers.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il recibe presente de delegación china
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il recibe presente de delegación china
						
Pyongyang, 20 de mayo (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il recibió presente que le dirigiera la delegación del Comité Nacional de la Conferencia Consultiva Política del Pueblo Chino presidida por el vicepresidente, Chen Zongxing, de vista en Corea.
					  El jefe de la delegación lo entregó el día 20 a Kim Yong Nam, presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la República Popular Democrática de Corea.

articles.title: Chen Zongxing aboga por desarrollo de amistad China-Corea
articles.content:
Chen Zongxing aboga por desarrollo de amistad China-Corea
Pyongyang, 20 de mayo (ATCC) -- El vicepresidente del Comité Nacional de la Conferencia Consultiva Política del Pueblo Chino (CCPPCh), Chen Zongxing, quien realiza una visita a la República Popular Democrática de Corea al frente de la delegación de esa entidad, se entrevistó con la ATCC antes de regreso a su país.
					Él subrayó que la CCPPCh se esforzará por contribuir mucho al fortalecimiento y al desarrollo de la tradicional amistad China-Corea, y prosiguió:
					
					Durante nuestra estancia en Corea, nos quedamos profundamente impresionados de la intensa lucha del pueblo coreano por desarrollar la economía y mejorar la vida del pueblo con el espíritu revolucionario de autoconfianza.
					
					Sobre todo, nos dejó muy conmovidos la Exposición Permanente de Amistad Internacional.
					
					Ahí están exhibidos los presentes enviados desde varios países del mundo al Presidente Kim Il Sung y al Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					A través de la visita, nos conocimos bien de la veneración de los pueblos del mundo hacia ellos.
					
					Los revolucionarios de veterana generación de China y el Presidente Kim Il Sung forjaron la amistad entre ambos países en la lucha por el cumplimiento de la causa común.
					
					Estas relaciones de amistad se desarrollan de día en día bajo la profunda atención del Secretario General Hu Jintao y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					China y Corea activan el intercambio y cooperación en varios sectores como la política, la economía, la cultura, etc.
					
					La amistad China-Corea se estableció con sangre.
					
					Esto es un patrimonio valioso para los partidos, gobiernos y pueblos de ambos países.
					
					Estamos convencidos de que bajo la guía del gran Dirigente, el pueblo coreano acelerará con más vigor la producción y la construcción para acoger con orgullo 2012, año del centenario de natalicio del Presidente Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Acto al 20 aniversario de publicación de obra de Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Acto al 20 aniversario de publicación de obra de Kim Jong Il
Pyongyang, 20 de mayo (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el día 20 en el Palacio Cultural del Pueblo el acto dedicado al 20º aniversario de la publicación de la obra del Dirigente Kim Jong Il "El arte arquitectónico", publicada el 21 de mayo del 80 (1991) de la Era Juche.
					  El trabajo dilucida de modo científico las relaciones entre la arquitectura y la sociedad y  entre la arquitectura y el ser humano, y aclara de nuevo la esencia el carácter y la misión de la arquitectura del socialismo, la posición y el papel que ocupa la arquitectura en el desarrollo social y los problemas fundamentales de la creación de arquitectura socialista
					
					  En la ocasión estuvieron presentes el premier del Consejo de Ministros Choe Yong Rim, el ministro de Construcción e Industria de Materiales de Construcción Tong Jong Ho, el ministro de Urbanismo Hwang Hak Won, el ministro de Protección Territorial y Ambiental Kim Chang Ryong, los funcionarios de ministerios y órganos centrales, los diseñadores arquitecturales y funcionarios de esta rama en la capital.
					
					  El ministro de Control Estatal de las Construcciones y presidente de la Unión de Arquitectos de corea, Pae Tal Jun, en su informe, dijo que la citada obra sistematiza globalmente todos los problemas teóricos y prácticos que se presentan en la creación de arquitectura del socialismo.
					
					  Él se refirió a que el Dirigente Kim Jong Il llamó enérgicamente  a los arquitectos y constructores a la lucha por hacer florecer el deseo del Presidente   Kim Il Sung de construir la rica patria.
					
					  Destacó que gracias a la abnegación patriótica del Dirigente se prepara el paraíso de la época del Songun y se logran grandes éxitos en la lucha por el mejoramiento de la vida del pueblo y la construcción de la gran potencia próspera y.
					
					  Subrayó que los funcionarios y los trabajadores de la rama de arquitectura y construcción deben dedicar toda la inteligencia, talentos y entusiasmo en la gran construcción de hoy y contribuir verdaderamente a adelantar la construcción de la gran potencia próspera.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun comenta la reciente visita de Lee Myung Bak a Alemania
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun comenta la reciente visita de Lee Myung Bak a Alemania
Pyongyang, 20 de mayo (ATCC) -- El diario Rodong Sinmun publicó en su edición de este viernes un artículo individual criticando lo que dijo el traidor Lee Myung Bak durante su reciente visita a Alemania.
					En esa ocasión, él trató de denigrar a toda costa a la República Popular Democrática de Corea exponiendo abiertamente su ánimo conflictivo con el muy digno régimen de ella, adelanta el articulista y continúa:
					
					Ese político iletrado e imbécil se atrevió a pronunciar hasta en el extranjero unas palabras provocativas a la RPDC.
					
					En cuanto a la situación de emergencia, ésta puede ocurrir sólo a la camarilla de conservadores surcoreanos que no tiene una correcta filosofía política y está agobiada ante la impetuosa lucha anti-"gubernamental" de las masas populares.
					
					El traidor Lee Myung Bak, que no sabe manejar ni los asuntos de su casa, se atreve a atentar contra el socialismo de la RPDC que significa la vida para el pueblo de ésta.
					
					Sus pretensiones constituyen un insulto y provocación intolerables contra la RPDC.
					
					La campaña de enfrentamiento entre los regímenes, que lanza la banda de conservadores surcoreanos, es una locura antinacional para alcanzar la "reunificación bajo el sistema democrático liberal" acabando con la connacional RPDC.
					
					No se puede perdonar en ningún caso tal acto criminal que desafía a la corriente de la historia nacional hacia la reunificación independiente, la paz y la prosperidad.
